title: Body Movements
description: Learn about different types of body movements, joints, and the skeletal system.

questions.question: Which of these is a ball and socket joint?
questions.explanation: The shoulder joint is a ball and socket joint that allows movement in all directions.

questions.question: What is the function of the ribcage?
questions.explanation: The ribcage protects important internal organs like the heart and lungs.

questions.question: Which of these is a hinge joint?
questions.explanation: The knee is a hinge joint that allows movement in one direction, like a door hinge.

questions.question: What is the function of cartilage?
questions.explanation: Cartilage reduces friction between bones at joints and acts as a cushion.

questions.question: Which of these is a fixed joint?
questions.explanation: The joints between skull bones are fixed joints that don't allow movement.

questions.question: What is the function of the backbone?
questions.explanation: The backbone (spine) supports the body and protects the spinal cord.

questions.question: Which of these is a pivot joint?
questions.explanation: The neck has a pivot joint that allows the head to rotate from side to side.

questions.question: What is the function of ligaments?
questions.explanation: Ligaments are tough bands of tissue that connect bones to bones at joints.

questions.question: Which of these is a gliding joint?
questions.explanation: The wrist has gliding joints that allow bones to slide over each other.

questions.question: What is the function of tendons?
questions.explanation: Tendons are tough bands of tissue that connect muscles to bones, allowing movement.
